definition: vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
cavity of body/barrel (e.g. engine cylinder)/compartment/tune/accent of speech

sentences.english: Some government officials speuak in favour of the company that destroyed the earth.
sentences.chinese: 有些政府官員爲那家破壞地球的公司幫腔。

sentences.english: When he saw nobody supporting him, he no longer insisted.
sentences.chinese: 他看見沒有人幫腔，也就不再堅持了。

sentences.english: Finally, the other girl chimed in. “Four dollars, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: 最後，其他女孩幫腔英寸“四美元，”她說。

sentences.english: Finally, the other girl chimed in. "Four dollars, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 最後，其他女孩幫腔英寸“四美元，”她說。

definition: variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
